sen.j: 宮津駅（みやづえき）は、京都府宮津市字鶴賀にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道（KTR）の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Aza-Tsuraga of Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, Miyazu Station is a stop on the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR.)
Miyazu Station, located in Aza-Tsuraga of Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Miyazu Station, located in Aza-Tsuruga of Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).

sen.j: この駅には、北近畿タンゴ鉄道の事業本部がおかれている。
sen.e: Business headquarters of Kitakinki Tango Railway are established at this station.
The business headquarters of Kitakinki Tango Railway are housed at this station.
The business headquarters of Kitakinki Tango Railway are housed at this station.

sen.j: 利用可能な鉄道路線
北近畿タンゴ鉄道
北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線
北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線
駅構造
各ホーム・線路は西舞鶴方から見て南西方向に伸びている。
sen.e: Each platform and every track extends southwesterly when seen from the direction of Nishi-Maizuru.
Each platform and every track extends southwesterly when seen from the direction of Nishi-Maizuru.
Each platform and every track extends southwesterly when seen from the direction of Nishi-Maizuru.

sen.j: 島式・相対式3面4線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: It is an above ground station having two platforms with track on one side only opposite each other at a distance and a double tracked Island type platform in between for a total of three platforms and four tracks.

It is an aboveground station having two platforms with track on one side only opposite each other at a distance, with a double-tracked island-type platform in between for a total of three platforms and four tracks.

It is an aboveground station having two platforms with track on one side only opposite each other at a distance, with a double-tracked island-type platform in between for a total of three platforms and four tracks.

sen.j: 北西側・南東側それぞれに駅舎があるが、本屋は北西側で、みどりの窓口があり、終日駅員が配置されている。
sen.e: A station building stands on both northwestern and southeastern sides, the one on the northwestern side having a JT Ticket Window (Midori-no-madoguchi) is the main segment and staff stationed there all day long.

A station building stands on both the northwestern and southeastern sides, but the one on the northwestern side having a JT ticket window (Midori-no-madoguchi) is the main segment and staff are stationed there throughout the day.

A station building stands on both the northwestern and southeastern sides, but the one on the northwestern side having a JR Ticket Office (Midori-no-madoguchi) is the main segment and staff are stationed there throughout the day.

sen.j: 南東側の駅舎は宮福鉄道開業時からのもので、自動券売機と待合室のみである。
sen.e: The segment on the southeastern side was constructed when Miyafuku railway was inaugurated and houses only automated ticket gates and a waiting room.
The segment on the southeastern side was constructed when the Miyafuku railway was inaugurated, and houses only automated ticket gates and a waiting room.
The segment on the southeastern side was constructed when the Miyafuku Railway was inaugurated, and it houses only automated ticket gates and a waiting room.

sen.j: 跨線橋は、国鉄時代からのものが本屋駅舎寄り1番のりばと2番3番のりばの間に、宮福鉄道開業時に増設した架空電車線方式対応高さのものが2番3番のりばと4番のりばの間にある。
sen.e: The overbridge abover Track No.1 platform and between Tracks No.2 and No.3 platform nearer the main segment was constructed when government owned, and the section to span the distance between No.2 and No.3 track platform and No.4 track platform fit for the height of aerial type electric train wiring, was additionally installed when Miyafuku Railway commenced operations.

The overbridge above the track No. 1 platform and between the platform for track nos. 2 and 3 nearer the main segment was constructed during government ownership; and the section that spans the distance between the platform for track nos. 2 and 3 and the track No. 4 platform, fit for the height of aerial-type electric train wiring, was installed when Miyafuku Railway commenced operations.

The overbridge above Platform 1 and between Platform 2 and 3 nearer the main segment was constructed during government ownership, and the section that spans the distance between Platform 2 and 3 and Platform 4, fit for the height of aerial-type electric train wiring, was installed when Miyafuku Railway commenced operations.

sen.j: 架線は3番線・4番線に設置されている。
sen.e: Overhead wiring is installed for Track No.3 and Track No.4.
Overhead wiring is installed for track nos. 3 and 4.
Overhead wiring is installed for Platform 3 and 4.

sen.j: 本屋駅舎の外壁は白磁タイル装で、海園都市である宮津市を象徴している。
sen.e: The exterior of the main structure of the station is tiled with white porcelain and symbolic of Miyazu City, the Kaien-toshi (literally Sea Garden City.)
The exterior of the main structure of the station is tiled with white porcelain and is symbolic of Miyazu City, the Kaien-toshi (literally Sea Garden City).
The exterior of the main structure of the station is tiled with white porcelain and is symbolic of Miyazu City, the Kaien-toshi (literally Sea Garden City).

sen.j: 広場は本屋駅舎に接し、バス停留所、タクシーのりばがある。
sen.e: The plaza is adjacent to the main structure of the station and is where bus and taxi boarding platforms are located.
The plaza is adjacent to the main structure of the station and is where the bus and taxi boarding platforms are located.
The plaza is adjacent to the main structure of the station and is where the bus and taxi boarding platforms are located.

sen.j: のりば
1：特急タンゴディスカバリー（京都行き）、宮津線（丹後由良・西舞鶴方面）
sen.e: 1: Limited express Tango Discovery (for Kyoto), Miyatsu Ｌｉｎｅ (for Tango-Yura・Nishi-Maizuru, etc.)
1: Limited express "Tango Discovery" (for Kyoto), Miyatsu Ｌｉｎｅ (for Tango-Yura・Nishi-Maizuru, etc.)
1: Limited Express Tango Discovery (for Kyoto) on Miyazu Ｌｉｎｅ (for Tango-Yura, Nishi-Maizuru, etc.)
sen.cmt: 括弧削除 on Miyazu Lineとしました

sen.j: 2：特急タンゴディスカバリー（久美浜行き）、宮津線（天橋立・豊岡方面）
sen.e: 2: Limited express "Tango Discovery" (for Kumihama,) Miyatsu Line (for Amanohashidate・Toyooka)
2: Limited express "Tango Discovery" (for Kumihama), Miyatsu Line (for Amanohashidate・Toyooka)
2: Limited Express Tango Discovery (for Kumihama) on Miyazu Line (for Amanohashidate, Toyooka)
sen.cmt: 括弧削除 on Miyazu Lineとしました

sen.j: 3：特急はしだて・文殊・タンゴエクスプローラー、宮津線・宮福線
sen.e: "3: Limited express trains Hashidate・Monju・Tango Explorer, Miyazu Line・Miyafuku Line
3: Limited express trains Hashidate・Monju・Tango Explorer, Miyazu Line・Miyafuku Line
3: Limited Express trains Hashidate, Monju, Tango Explorer on Miyazu Line and Miyafuku Line

sen.j: 4：宮福線（当駅始発）
配線上、宮津線・宮福線相互の直通列車は、3番のりばのみを使用する。
sen.e: Mutual direct trains of both Miyazu and Miyafuku Lines use only No. 3 Track platform from track arrangement.
Mutual direct trains of the Miyazu and Miyafuku lines use only the track No. 3 platform due to the track arrangement.
Mutual direct trains of the Miyazu and Miyafuku lines use only Platform 3 due to the track arrangement.

sen.j: 天橋立駅方面から宮福線を経由（或いはその逆）する列車は、スイッチバックを行う。
sen.e: Miyazu is the switchback station for trains going via Miyafuku Line from the direction of Amanohashidate (or vice versa)
Miyazu is the switchback station for trains going via the Miyafuku Line from the direction of Amanohashidate (or vice versa).
Miyazu is the switchback station for trains going via the Miyafuku Line from the direction of Amanohashidate (or vice versa).

sen.j: 臨港線
1938年（昭和13年）に宮津港鶴賀第二ふ頭、鶴賀第一ふ頭までの専用鉄道が設置された。
sen.e: An industrial railway was installed up to Tsuraga No.1 and No.2 piers of Miyazu Port in 1938.
An industrial railway was installed up to Tsuraga pier nos. 1 and 2 of Miyazu Port in 1938.
An industrial railway was installed up to Tsuruga pier nos. 1 and 2 of Miyazu Port in 1938.

sen.j: 1981年（昭和56年）に廃止された。
利用状況
宮津市は天橋立を抱える日本を代表する観光都市であるが、天橋立へは隣駅の天橋立駅があるため、観光客はそれほど多くない。
sen.e: Miyazu City is a tourist city representing Japan from its having Amanohashidate, but the number of tourists using this station is not so large as access to Amanohashidate is more convenient from neighboring Amanohashidate Station.
sen.cmt: 論理的に頷けないところもありますが、"あるため"を"より都合が良い（近くを避け）"にしました。
sen.e: Miyazu City is a tourist destination that is representative of Japan due to its Amanohashidate, but the number of tourists using this station is very large; therefore, access to Amanohashidate is more convenient from neighboring Amanohashidate Station.

Miyazu City is a tourist destination representing Japan due to its Amanohashidate, but the number of tourists using this station is not so large as access to Amanohashidate is more convenient from neighboring Amanohashidate Station.
sen.cmt: 修正前の翻訳が適切と判断し、戻しました。

sen.j: しかし宮津市の玄関駅のため、市民の利用は多い。
sen.e: However, many citizens use this station as it is the gateway station to Miyazu City.
However, many people use this station because it's the gateway station to Miyazu City.
However, many citizens use this station as it is the gateway station to Miyazu City.
sen.cmt: 修正前の翻訳が適切と判断し、戻しました。

sen.j: 当駅から西舞鶴駅方面へ向かう宮津線、京都駅・大阪駅方面へ向かう宮福線が分岐しているが、利用者数は宮津線が圧倒的に多い反面、宮福線は長距離利用者が多いのが特徴である。
sen.e: Miyazu Line for Nishi-Maizuru and Miyafuku Line for Kyoto Station and Osaka Station branch at this station and characteristics are that, although the number of passengers using Miyazu Line overwhelmingly exceeds that of the Miyafuku Line, the latter carries more long distance travelers.

The Miyazu Line for Nishi-Maizuru and the Miyafuku Line for Kyoto Station and Osaka Station branch at this station; the characteristics are that, although the number of passengers using the Miyazu Line far surpasses that of the Miyafuku Line, the latter carries more long-distance travelers.

The Miyazu Line for Nishi-Maizuru and the Miyafuku Line for Kyoto Station and Osaka Station branch at this station; the characteristics are that, although the number of passengers using the Miyazu Line far surpasses that of the Miyafuku Line, the latter carries more long-distance travelers.

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員（京都府統計書より）
sen.e: Number of passengers getting on per day in fiscal 2006 (Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
Number of passengers getting on per day in fiscal 2006 (source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一

sen.j: 宮津線 - 532人（内、定期利用318人）
宮福線 - 304人（内、定期利用25人）
合計 - 836人（内、定期利用347人）
sen.e: Total - 836 (amongst which 347 were commuter pass users)

sen.j: 宮津温泉 ピント湯
ニッポンレンタカー
バス
丹後海陸交通
天橋立駅・伊根町役場前・経ヶ岬・袖志行き

For: Amanohashidate・Kaya-cho-yakuba・Kaya Steam Locomotive Square・Kaya-no-Sato (only two round trips)

日本交通 (福知山市)
京都タクシー 宮津営業所
sen.e: Kyoto Taxi Co., Ltd. Miyazu Office
Kyoto Taxi Co., Ltd. Miyazu Office

sen.j: 歴史
1924年（大正13年）4月12日 - 日本国有鉄道峰山線の駅として開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated on April 12, 1924 as a Japanese National Railways' station on the Mineyama Line.
Inaugurated on April 12, 1924 as a Japanese National Railways' station on the Mineyama Line.
April 12, 1924: The station was inaugurated as a Japan National Railways' station on the Mineyama Line.
sen.cmt: Japan National Railwaysとしました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 旅客・貨物取り扱い開始。
sen.e: It commenced handling passengers and freight.
It commenced handling passengers and freight.

sen.j: 当初は終着駅。
sen.e: It was a terminal station at the outset.

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）7月31日 - 宮津駅～丹後山田駅（現在の野田川駅）間延伸により中間駅となる。
sen.e: Became an intermediate station on July 31, 1925 as a result of Mineyama Line being extended to Tango Yamada Station (now Nodagawa Station.)
It became an intermediate station on July 31, 1925 as a result of Mineyama Line being extended to Tango Yamada Station (now Nodagawa Station).
July 31, 1925: The station became an intermediate station as a result of Mineyama Line being extended to Tango-Yamada Station (now Nodagawa Station).
sen.cmt: Tango-Yamada Stationとしました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）8月10日 - 峰山線が宮津線に路線名改称。
sen.e: Mineyama Line renamed Miyazu Line on Aug. 10, 1932.
The Mineyama Line was renamed the Miyazu Line on Aug. 10, 1932.
August. 10, 1932: The Mineyama Line was renamed the Miyazu Line.

sen.j: 1985年（昭和60年）3月14日 - 貨物取り扱い廃止。
sen.e: Handling of freight discontinued on Mar. 14, 1985.
The handling of freight was discontinued on Mar. 14, 1985.
March 14, 1985: The handling of freight was discontinued.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により西日本旅客鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）7月16日 - 宮福鉄道宮福線が開通、接続駅となる。
sen.e: Became junction station from inauguration of Miyafuku Railway, Miyafuku Line on July 16, 1988.
It became a junction station from the inauguration of Miyafuku Railway, Miyafuku Line on July 16, 1988.
July 16, 1988: The station became a junction station from the inauguration of Miyafuku Railway, Miyafuku Line.

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）8月1日 - 宮福鉄道が北近畿タンゴ鉄道に改称。
sen.e: Miyafuku Railway renamed Kitakinki Tango Railway on Aug. 1, 1989.
Miyafuku Railway was renamed Kitakinki Tango Railway on Aug. 1, 1989.
August 1, 1989: Miyafuku Railway was renamed Kitakinki Tango Railway.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）4月1日 - 宮津線が北近畿タンゴ鉄道に移管と同時に、同鉄道の駅となり現在の駅舎に改築される。
sen.e: Became a Kitakinki Tango Railway station on April 1, 1990 simultaneously with transfer of Miyazu Line to Kitakinki Tango Railway and station building reconstructed as it stands today.

It became a station of the Kitakinki Tango Railway on April 1, 1990 simultaneously with the transfer of the Miyazu Line to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and the station building was reconstructed as it stands today.

April 1, 1990: The station became a station of the Kitakinki Tango Railway simultaneously with the transfer of the Miyazu Line to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and the station building was reconstructed as it stands today.

sen.j: 隣の駅
北近畿タンゴ鉄道
宮津線
